programme.title: Shotgun Slade
programme.desc: Slade is hired to find out who is stealing gold ore from a mining company.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Pat and his cousin inherit some land that is coveted by some unscrupulous ranchers.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Roy saves a group of archeological students taken hostage by robbers.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: An outlaw gang tries to steal an old prospector's life savings.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: An outlaw gang assigns an orphaned teenager (Harry Harvey, Jr.) the task of murdering Roy.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Roy debunks an old Western legend about a one-armed ghost.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: A 10-year-old orphan (B.G. Norman) protects his uncle's illegal gold mine.

programme.title: Bandit Queen
programme.desc: A young woman (Barbara Britton) becomes a masked avenger after gold-grabbers kill her Spanish parents in old California.

programme.title: Northern Patrol
programme.desc: Corporal Webb finds a man who seems to have hung himself after writing a suicide note. Webb notes this happened while the suicider was in the midst of cooking himself a meal, and concludes that all is not right in this part of Canada.

programme.title: Arizona Bound
programme.desc: The Rough Riders (Buck Jones, Tim McCoy, Raymond Hatton) team up to save a woman's stagecoach line from a Mesa City saloon gang.

programme.title: Angel and the Badman
programme.desc: A Quaker (Gail Russell) and her family reform a wounded outlaw (John Wayne) who has a killer on his trail.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Two traildrivers are shanghaied shortly after the Ponderosa cattle herd arrives in San Francisco.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: When a neighbor agrees to sell his property, the Cartwrights fear the loss of water rights for their cattle.

programme.title: 26 Men
programme.desc: Captain Rynning struggles to find enough men to capture a gang of escaped convicts after they escape from prison.

programme.title: 26 Men
programme.desc: When Clint Travis is falsely accused of a murder, Rynning sends him into Galioro Mountains to prove his innocence by finding the cattle rustlers who actually committed the crime.

programme.title: 26 Men
programme.desc: Travis goes after escaped con Cain Devers, a bank robber and counterfeiter who is using his counterfeit plates as part of a plot to destroy his father and younger brother.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Margaret head to Denver in the late 1860's after the killing of a railroad telegraph operator; bail jumper L H Musgrove, a known horse thief is their chief suspect; Musgrove and his pal end up facing vigilante justice.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt Clark and Frankie Adams pursue a female outlaw named Belle Starr after her gang steals a herd of horses from the U.S. cavalry.

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: Joey and Pete go hunting, but what they find is trouble when an escaped criminal crosses their path.

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: During a drought, Joey becomes a junior ranger and tries to protect a couple of hunters from starting a forest fire.

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: Fury keeps running off to be with a white mare; Joey gets in trouble when he tries to solve the relationship.

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: Fury is missing.

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: A man claiming to be Joey's father shows up at the ranch.

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: A stranger claims to be Joey's father, and threatens to take the boy away from Jim and Fury.

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: Joey and Frankie Watson both enter lambs in the 4-H Club Livestock Show.

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: At a junior rodeo, a competitor underhandedly switches horses with Joey.

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: Bank robbers hide their ill-gotten gains at a local ghost town.

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: A man on the run from the law takes a job at the ranch, but when he's discovered he must decide whether to flee or stay and help Fury.

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: Joey and Hank go after some claim jumpers at a local tungsten mine. Jim Newton: Peter Graves.

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: The spoiled daughter of a deceased veteran comes to stay with the Newtons.

programme.title: Below the Border
programme.desc: The Rough Riders (Buck Jones, Tim McCoy, Raymond Hatton) pose as strangers and nab outlaws near the Mexican border.

programme.title: Forbidden Trails
programme.desc: Ex-convicts lure one of the Rough Riders (Buck Jones, Tim McCoy, Raymond Hatton) to a kerosene-soaked shack.

programme.title: The Dawn Rider
programme.desc: A cowboy (John Wayne) romances a pretty woman (Marion Burns) while tracking the outlaw gang that killed his father.

programme.title: The Desert Trail
programme.desc: A rodeo rider (John Wayne) and his assistant (Eddy Chandler) are accused of robbing and murdering a promoter and must assume new identities to track down and bring the real killers to justice.

programme.title: The Escape of Prisoner 614
programme.desc: After two deputy sheriffs lose their jobs because of poor arrest records, they pursue an escaped convict to try and win back their badges. Nabbing the convict won't be half as dangerous as facing the ruthless sheriff who is tracking their every move.
